gurmukhi: b`jy bjMqR g`jy subwh ] swvMq dyK ACRI auCwh ] rIJMq dyv A`dyv srb ] gwvMq gIq qj dIn grb ]531]
transliteration: Bajje Bajantra Gadje Soubaah|| Saavant Dekh Chhriouchhaad|| Rijhant Dev Addev Sarab|| Gadvant Geet Taj Deen Gadab||531||
translation: The war-musical instruments were played and the warriors thundered; seeing the Lords, the heavenly damsels were filled with zeal; the gods and others, all were pleased and all of them, abandoning their pride began to sing songs.531.

gurmukhi: sijE su sYx sux cIn rwj ] b`jy bjMqR srbM smwj ] c`ly AcMl j`vwl ju`D ] brKMq bwx Br loh kRu`D ]532]
transliteration: Sajio Su Sain Cheen Raaj|| Bajjebajantra Saraban Samaaj|| Challe Achall Javvaal Juddh|| Barkhanndbaan Bhar Lohkruddh||532||
translation: Listening to the news about the arrival of the army, the king of China caused the war-horns to be sounded in all his territory; all the warriors marched for the war and in their fury, they began to discharge arrows.532.

gurmukhi: Ku`ly K`qMg KUnI KqiHwx ] au`Jry ju`D joDw mhwx ] DukMq DuMD GuMmMq Gwie ] ickMq cwr cwvfI su cwie ]533]
transliteration: Khulle Khattan Khoonikhatrihaan|| Ujjdare Juddh Jodhaa Mahaan|| Dhoukant Dhoundh Ghounmant Ghaae|| Chikant Chaar Chaavadisu Chaae||533||
translation: The bloody daggers came out and the great warriors died in the war; the wounds were inflicted and the atmosphere became foggy with the dust of the feet of the warriors; the shouts of vultures were heard in all the four directions.533.

gurmukhi: h`sMq hws kwlI krwl ] BBkMq BUq BYro ibswl ] lwgMq bwx BwKMq mws ] BwjMq BIr huie huie audws ]534]
transliteration: Hassant Haas Kaalikaraal|| Bhabhkant Bhoot Bhairo Bidaal|| Laagadt Baan Bhaakhannddmaas|| Bhaajant Bheer Hue Hue Udaas||534||
translation: The dreadful Kali laughed and the huge Bhairavas and the ghosts shouted; the arrows were inflicted; the ghosts and fiends ate the flesh the cowards in their anxiety began to run away.534.

gurmukhi: ciVE cIn rwjM ] sjy srb swjM ] Kuly Kyq KUnI ] cVy cOp dUnI ]535]
transliteration: Chadio Cheen Raajan|| Saje Sarab Saajan|| Khule Khet Kheenee|| Chade Chaoup Doonee||535||
translation: The king of China attacked; he was ready in every way; the bloody daggers came out of scabbards with double zeal.535.

gurmukhi: juty joD joDM ] qjY bwx kRoDM ] qutY AMg BMgM ] BRmy AMg jMgM ]536]
transliteration: Joute Jodh Jodhan|| Tajai Baan Krodhan|| Toutai An Bhanadg|| Bhrame An Janadg||536||
translation: The warriors, getting enraged, discharged arrows and roamed in the battlefield, destroying the limbs of others.536.

gurmukhi: ncy eIs sIsM ] imlY sYx eIsM ] krY icqR cwrM ] qjy bwx DwrM ]537]
transliteration: Nache Is Seesan|| Milai Sain Eesan|| Darai Chitra Chaaran|| Taje Baan Daaran||537||
translation: Shiva also joined the armies and danced and discharged arrows in a queer way.537.

gurmukhi: mfy joD joDM ] qjy bwx kRoDM ] ndI sRox pUrM ] iPrI gYx hUrM ]538]
transliteration: Made Jodh Jodhan|| Taje Baan Krodhan|| Nadisron Pooran|| Phirigadn Hooran||538||
translation: The warriors in their fury discharged arrows in the battlefield; the streams of blood were full and the heavenly damsels moved in the sky.538.

gurmukhi: hsY muMf mwlw ] qjY jog jÍwlw ] qjY bwx jÍwxM ] gRsy duSt pRwxM ]539]
transliteration: Hasai Mounnd Maalaa|| Tajai Jog Jvaalaa|| Tajai Baan Jvaanan|| Grase Dousht Praanan||539||
translation: The goddess kali laughed and produced fire of Yoga; the tyrants were killed with the arrows of the soldiers.539.

gurmukhi: igry GUMm BUmI ] auTI DUr DUMmI ] su By ryq KyqM ] ncy BUq pRyqM ]540]
transliteration: Gire Ghoonm Bhoomee|| Outhi Dhoor Dhoonmee|| Su Bhe Ret Khetan|| Nache Bhoot Pretan||540||
translation: The warriors are swinging and falling on the ground and the dust is rising from the earth; the fighters have gathered zealously in the battlefield and the ghosts and fiends are dancing.540.

gurmukhi: imilE cIn rwjw ] Bey srb kwjw ] lieE sMg kY kY ] cilE A`gR hÍY kY ]541]
transliteration: Milio Cheen Raajaa|| Bade Sarab Kaajaa|| Laio San Kai Kai|| Chadio Aggra Hvai Kai||541||
translation: The king of China met his men, whose objectives were fulfilled; he took many with himself and advanced forward.541.

gurmukhi: ley sMg niRp srb bjy ibjeI duMdB rx ] suBy sUr sMgRwm inrK rIJeI ApCr gx ]
transliteration: Lae San Nrip Sarab Bade Bijaidoundabb Ran|| Soubhe Soor Sanraam Nirakh Reejhaiapachhar Gad||
translation: The king took all alongwith him and the drums of victory sounded; the warriors gathered in the battlefield and seeing them, the heavenly damsels were allured;
